document.docAuthor: Soto, Eduardo M. & Ramírez, Martín J.
document.docTitle: Philisca atrata Soto & Ramírez 2012, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Revision and phylogenetic analysis of the spider genus Philisca Simon (Araneae: Anyphaenidae, Amaurobioidinae) 3443

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision and phylogenetic analysis of the spider genus Philisca Simon (Araneae: Anyphaenidae, Amaurobioidinae) 3443

materialsCitation.collectorName: P. Nac. Nahuel Huapi & M. Ramirez & Lago Steffen

517m
,
1.I.2011
, M. Ramírez , 1 male ( MACN-Ar 28020 ); female paratype from Río Negro province , P. Nac. Nahuel Huapi , mirador camino al Lago Steffen , 41.51189 ºS 71.49218 ºW, elev.
955m
(barómetro),
1.I.2011
, M. Ramírez , 1 female ( MACN-Ar 28022 ).

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology: The specific name is a Latin word (blackened), referring to the dark body of this species.

Diagnosis: It resembles other species of the
ornata
group by the modified male chelicerae and the epigyne with smooth, heart shaped median field close to the epigastric furrow ( Figs 35b , 13e, f ), and is very similar to
P. accentifera
by having the AME larger than the ALE. It can be distinguished from the latter species by the darker dorsal abdominal pattern, with a central shiny brown patch and white lateral bands ( Figs 1e , 14d , 16 ). The male palpal bulb has a sinuous PMA ( Fig. 20e ), and the female epigyne has the anterior pouch of the median field with lumen longer than wide ( Fig. 32a, b ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 18.
Philisca atrata
new species (MACN-Ar 28022) a–d female paratype ( a dorsal habitus; b prosoma, dorsal view; c ventral habitus; d prosoma, ventral view).

FIGURE 19.
Philisca atrata
new species (MACN-Ar 28020) a–d male ( a dorsal habitus; b prosoma, dorsal view; c ventral habitus; d prosoma, ventral view).

FIGURE 20.
Philisca atrata
new species (MACN-Ar 28020 and EMS-00134). Male, a–c left palp ( a prolateral view, b ventral view, c retrolateral view); d–h copulatory bulb ( d prolateral view, e ventral view, f retrolateral view, g apical view, h apical– retrolateral detail view). (C: conductor, E: embolus, MA: median apophysis, PMA: paramedian apophysis, rPMA: retrolateral cusp of the paramedian apophysis).

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Female ( paratype MACN-Ar 28022): Total length 5.59. Prosoma length 1.83, width 1.27, wider between legs II–III. Tibia/metatarsus length: I , 0.87/0.67; II , 0.83/0.63; III , 0.63/0.70; IV , 1.03/0.93. Chelicerae with three teeth on promargin (middle tooth bigger than others), three little teeth on retromargin. Sternum length 0.88, width 0.75. Spines: leg I , femur d 1–1–1, p d2ap; tibia v 0–p1–0; metatarsus v 2bas. II , femur d 1–1–1, p d1ap; tibia v p1ap; metatarsus v 2bas. III , femur d 1–1–1, p and r d1ap; patella r d1; tibia v p1–p1–2, p and r d1–1; metatarsus v 2–p1–2, d 0–p1–2, p 0–d1–1 and r d1–0–1. IV , femur d 1–1–1, p and r d1ap; patella r d1; tibia v p1– p1–2, p d1–1 and r 1–d1–1; metatarsus v 2–p1–2, d 0–p1–2, p and r d1–1–1. Color in ethanol ( Fig. 18 ): as in male, see below. Opisthosoma length 3.99, epigastrium–spiracle 2.03, spiracle–spinnerets 0.42. Epigyne ( Fig. 32a, b ) small, weakly sclerotized, translucent. MF heart-shaped. Anterior pouch deep, longer than wide. Ducts of AB long.

Variability: Spines in males: I , femur r 0; tibia v 0–p1–2 or 0–2–2. II , tibia v 0 or 0–p1–p1 or r1–2–2; metatarsus v 2–p1–0. III , tibia v 0–0–p1. Spines in females: I, tibia v 0–2–p1 or p1ap. II , tibia v 2ap or p1ap or 0. III , tibia v 0–p1–p1 or p1–p1–2; metatarsus v r1–0–2 or 2–0–2. IV , metatarsus v 2–0–2.
Distribution: Temperate forests and shrubs in Chile , from Antofagasta to Chiloé Provinces, and Argentina , from Neuquén to Chubut Provinces ( Fig. 38h ).
